item.description:
Hi All!
A number of you have shown interest in a weekday evening meetup in the downtown Boston area. Here it is! Please come and join us for a casual 1-1.5 hour ASL social on Wednesdays from 5:30 to 7 pm.

WHO: All who are interested in ASL are welcome to join us. Whether you're Deaf or hearing, beginner or fluent ASL user, we're here to share and socialize in this beautiful language.

WHERE: We'll be in the Panera on 115 Stuart Street (Corner of Stuart and Tremont), near the Theatre District. I will have a meetup sign at our table , and since we'll most likely be the only group of people signing, we should be pretty easy to spot.

RULES: Voices off, use paper and pen if you need to--this helps us learn and its Deaf friendly

RESOURCES: For those of you who are new to ASL and want to come prepared, here are some very good websites with free online classes.
http://www.westwoodasl.com/ http://www.lifeprint.com/ http://www.start-american-sign-language.com/

RSVP:Â Please RSVP for the meetup that you will be attending so we know how many people to expect. CONTACT: Please feel free to contact host Lilyan if you have any questions or concerns. Hope to see you there! :)
item.name: Downtown Boston Weekly ASL Social
